intro: Malvastrum mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and somewhat woody. The plant is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cotton and hibiscus.
